item.title: 主要中国市场需求减弱导致宝马盈利下降
item.description: 宝马汽车公司第二季度盈利下降，原因是其主要市场中国的销售额下降，这家德国公司加入了越来越多的汽车制造商的行列，与需求放缓作斗争。【原文：BMW AG earnings declined in the second quarter on waning sales in its key market China, where the German company joins a growing list of automakers struggling with a demand slowdown.】

item.title: ING上调收入预期，利润超出预期
item.description: ING Groep NV 的利润超过了分析师的预期，原因是费用增长，这促使该银行上调了收入预期。【原文：ING Groep NV’s profit beat analysts’ estimates on growing fees, prompting the lender to increase its revenue outlook.】

item.title: 澳门博彩业收入再次低于预期，原因是对打击博彩业的担忧
item.description: 7月份澳门博彩业收入增长依然疲软，未能达到分析师的预期，这表明中国政府对非法汇兑活动和跨境赌博的打击削弱了玩家的情绪。【原文：Macau’s gaming revenue growth remained sluggish in July, failing to meet analysts’ expectation in a sign that Beijing’s crackdown on illegal money exchange activities and cross-border gambling has dented sentiment among players.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 法国农业信贷银行业绩超出预期，投资银行表现出色
item.description: 法国农业信贷银行（Credit Agricole SA）公布的第二季度利润超过了分析师的预期，原因是交易员和交易商表现出色，而且该银行开始看到法国利率上调带来的延迟收益。【原文：Credit Agricole SA posted a second-quarter profit that beat analysts estimates, as traders and deal-makers outperformed and the lender began to see the delayed benefit of higher interest rates in France.】

item.title: 零售业持续紧张，法国兴业银行交易员跑赢华尔街
item.description: 法国兴业银行（Societe Generale SA）公布的交易收入帮助这家法国银行跑赢了华尔街同行，尽管其国内零售部门的业绩仍然令人失望。【原文：Societe Generale SA posted trading revenue that helped the French bank outperform Wall Street peers, even as it continues to face disappointing performance at its domestic retail unit.】

item.title: 鲍威尔的意思是九月，无论他没说什么
item.description:
美联储正在尽可能强烈地暗示降息，同时留有余地，以防通胀或就业市场出现意外

。【原文：

The Fed is hinting at a rate cut as strongly as it can, while leaving wiggle room if inflation or the jobs market pull a surprise

】

item.title: 捷克在降息幅度问题上进退两难
item.description: 捷克央行行长们可能会放缓货币宽松政策的步伐，因为他们要权衡挥之不去的通胀风险和克朗贬值，以及弱于预期的经济增长。【原文：Czech central bankers might slow the pace of monetary easing as they weigh lingering inflation risks and koruna depreciation against weaker than expected economic growth.】

item.title: 大科技股跑赢比特币，特朗普贸易退潮拖累代币走势
item.description: 由于美国大选选情趋紧，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）是否有机会实施其支持加密货币的议程成了疑问，比特币未能赶上美联储鸽派言论引发的跨资产反弹。【原文：Bitcoin missed out on a cross-asset rally stoked by dovish Federal Reserve comments as a tightening US election race casts doubt on whether Donald Trump will get the chance to implement his pro-crypto agenda.】

item.title: 印度软件股反弹面临分析师质疑
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 美联储 9 月降息在即，铜和铁矿石上涨
item.description: 由于美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示该央行下个月将降息，这将促进全球经济增长，铜和铁矿石与大多数工业商品一起上涨。【原文：Copper and iron ore rose with most industrial commodities as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell flagged the central bank was on course to cut rates next month, which would be a boost for global growth.】

item.title: 外资买盘激增推动中国股市创数月来最佳表现
item.description: 周三，全球基金抢购了价值 27 亿美元的中国股票，这一突然回潮帮助推动了五个多月来的最佳涨势。【原文：Global funds snapped up $2.7 billion worth of Chinese stocks on Wednesday, a sudden comeback that helped drive the best rally in more than five months.】

item.title: 日本超低抵押贷款 17 年来首次增加
item.description: 日本央行近二十年来的第二次加息将影响数百万个人抵押贷款，一代人以来首次提高购房者的借贷成本。【原文：The Bank of Japan’s second interest-rate hike in nearly two decades is set to impact millions of personal mortgages, raising borrowing costs for homebuyers for the first time in a generation.】

item.title: 强大 "的日元反弹使 140 成为交易员的重要目标
item.description: 狂热的 24 小时交易为日元一年半多来表现最好的一个月画上了句号，这让 Amundi 和道明证券的策略师们认为，日元对美元汇率可能会走强至 140。【原文：The furious 24 hours of trading that capped the yen’s best month in more than a year-and-half has strategists at Amundi and TD Securities suggesting that the yen may strengthen as far as 140 versus the dollar.】

item.title: 中国工厂活动九个月来首次下滑
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，7 月份中国制造业活动出人意料地出现了九个月来的首次萎缩，这表明中国的出口机器可能正在降温，经济前景黯淡。【原文：China’s manufacturing activity unexpectedly shrank for the first time in nine months in July, a private survey showed, a sign the country’s export machine might be cooling, darkening the economy’s outlook.】

item.title: 出口商受日元汇率影响下跌，日本股市创 2020 年以来最大跌幅
item.description: 由于日元大幅反弹拖累出口商，以及央行加息拖累房地产股，日本股市暴跌，Topix 指数创下 2020 年 4 月以来最大跌幅。【原文：Japanese stocks plunged, with the Topix index falling the most since April 2020, as the yen’s sharp rally weighed on exporters and the central bank’s interest rate hike dragged down real estate shares.】

item.title: 日本房地产股因利率担忧创 2020 年以来最大跌幅
item.description: 日本中央银行上调基准利率后，人们担心抵押贷款利率将上调并抑制需求，日本房地产股价创下 2020 年 3 月以来最大跌幅。【原文：Japan’s real estate shares tumbled the most since March 2020 on concern mortgage rates will increase and sap demand after the nation’s central bank raised its benchmark interest rate.】

item.title: 科技股大跌，外资创纪录撤离台积电股票
item.description: 在全球投资者纷纷撤离人工智能领军企业之际，台湾积体电路制造股份有限公司（Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.【原文：Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. suffered its worst-ever selloff by foreign equity investors last month, amid a global rotation out of the leaders of the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 香港企业转向普通话和小红书求生存
item.description: 香港房地产经纪公司 Habitat Property 过去的主要业务依赖于该市的西方专业人士。如今情况不同了。【原文：Hong Kong real estate broker Habitat Property used to count on the city’s Western professionals for the bulk of its business. Things are different nowadays.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。鸽派的鲍威尔推动股市反弹。日元飙升至三月以来最强。美国考虑单方面限制中国芯片准入。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Dovish Powell fuels equity rally. Yen surges to strongest since March. US considers unilateral restrictions on China’s chip access. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 伊朗下令实施报复性打击的报道令石油价格继续上涨
item.description: 有报道称，伊朗领导人下令对以色列实施报复性打击，因为以色列在其领土上杀害了一名哈马斯领导人。【原文：Oil rose — after surging the most since October on Wednesday — following a report that Iran’s leader ordered a retaliatory strike on Israel for killing a Hamas leader on its soil.】

item.title: 尽管物价降温，澳大利亚提前大选的可能性仍较小
item.description: 在最新的通胀数据几乎排除了再次加息的可能性之后，澳大利亚中左翼政府终于松了一口气，尽管专家们表示，成本压力的消散速度太慢，不适合提前举行大选。【原文：Australia’s center-left government will be breathing a sigh of relief after the latest inflation data all-but ruled out another interest-rate hike, though experts say cost pressures are dissipating too slowly for an early election.】

item.title: 股市因美联储减息希望而反弹，日元走强：市场综述
item.description: 由于美联储不久将降息的迹象增强，亚洲股市周四普遍追随美国股市走高。日本股市则因日元走强而下跌。【原文：Equities in Asia were primed to broadly track US stocks higher Thursday on firming signs the Federal Reserve will soon cut interest rates. Japan was an outlier as stock futures fell to reflect a stronger yen.】

item.title: 医院销售陷入困境，Steward 3,000 万美元的生命线被暂停
item.description: 马萨诸塞州暂停向 Steward Health 提供 3,000 万美元的救命钱，Steward Health 正在关闭两家医院，并警告说，如果不能克服在出售其他六家医疗中心过程中遇到的障碍，可能很快就会被迫转移病人。【原文：Massachusetts paused a $30 million lifeline to Steward Health, which is closing two hospitals and warned it could soon be forced to move patients if it can’t overcome obstacles in its effort to sell six other medical centers.】

item.title: 香港物业代理公司在经济低迷时期利用家族办公室实现增长
item.description: 香港最大的房地产代理公司之一正在扩大其家族办公室服务，在房地产低迷的情况下寻找新的增长点。【原文：One of Hong Kong’s biggest property agencies is expanding its family office services, as it looks for new avenues of growth amid a downturn in real estate.】

item.title: Pilgrim's Pride 利润创历史新高，鸡肉业务势头强劲
item.description: Pilgrim's Pride Corp. 公布的盈利甚至超过了分析师的最高预期，表明鸡肉生产商的反弹势头强于预期。【原文：Pilgrim’s Pride Corp. posted earnings that beat even the highest of analyst estimates, signaling a stronger-than-expected rebound for chicken producers.】

item.title: 加拿大 S&P/TSX 综合指数首次突破 23,000 点
item.description: 加拿大股票基准 S&P/TSX 综合指数（S&P/TSX Composite Index）首次收于 23,000 点以上，原因是投资者转向价值股、商品股和低波动性股票。【原文：Canada’s stocks benchmark, the S&P/TSX Composite Index, has closed above 23,000 points for the first time as investors rotate into value, commodity and low-volatility stocks.】

item.title: 发行量创历史新高后，加拿大市场准备迎接债务大潮
item.description: 加拿大市场即将涌现一些大型债券交易，迄今为止，投资者一直在抢购这些债券。【原文：The Canadian market is about to be flooded with some big bond deals, and investors have so far been snatching up the debt.】

item.title: 美联储将华尔街的降息愿望摆上桌面，股市飙升
item.description: 在美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）为央行在 9 月份举行的下一次会议上降低借贷成本敞开大门之后，交易员们对即将到来的降息越来越乐观。【原文：Buy signals flashed across Wall Street Wednesday as traders grew optimistic rate cuts coming soon after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell left the door open to lowering borrowing costs at the central bank’s next meeting in September.】

item.title: 加拿大新管道石油出口从亚洲转向美国
item.description: 加拿大最近扩建的跨山输油管道的原油出口正从亚洲转向美国，这表明该大型项目对全球石油市场的影响仍在不断变化。【原文：Canadian crude exports from the recently expanded Trans Mountain pipeline are shifting to the US from Asia, showing how the major project’s effect on global oil markets remains in flux.】
